item.text:
Keeping Foreign Money Out of Politics Act of 2015

Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit foreign nationals from making contributions or donations in connection with state and local ballot initiatives and referenda.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Keeping Foreign Money Out of Politics Act of 2015

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DEUTCH:H.R. 2049.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Sec. 8, Clause 3: The Congress shall have Power .. . To regulate Commerce with foreign Nations, and among theseveral States, and with the Indian Tribes.''[Page H2498]

item.title: Keeping Foreign Money Out of Politics Act of 2015
To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit foreign nationals from making contributions or donations in connection with State and local ballot initiatives and referenda.
Keeping Foreign Money Out of Politics Act of 2015

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
